intro: Pekea tuberculosa, commonly known as the rough pekea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red.
